fourth noun [C]
(MUSIC)
music
  specialized the distance between two musical notes that are four notes apart: These intervals - octaves, fifths and fourths - are the ones that appear recurrently in folk songs across the world, as well as in classical music. These chords with augmented fourths are strongly dissonant.
More examplesFewer examplesThe music was over-reliant on simple harmonic formulas such as a straightforward row of ascending fourths.The piece contained chords with parallel fourths and fifths.The lush melodies were full of open fifths and augmented fourths and sevenths.

(in the position of) the number 4 in a series; 4th: Mark finished fourth in the race. [ C ] My birthday is on the fourth of December.
A fourth is one of four equal parts of something.
